FuncDef:
The ntp high-precision-time client enable command sets the interval at which a high-precision NTP client sends packets.
The undo ntp high-precision-time client enable command cancels the interval at which a high-precision NTP client sends packets. The ntp high-precision-time client enable command sets the interval at which a high-precision NTP client sends packets. The undo ntp high-precision-time client enable command cancels the interval at which a high-precision NTP client sends packets. By default, the interval at which a high-precision NTP client sends packets is not set.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the polling interval for sending NTP packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 2500, in milliseconds. The default value is 200.

Specifies the polling interval for sending packets.
-

Examples: Warning: After this configuration is committed, the polling interval of the client is subject to this configuration. Continue? [Y/N]:Y
ExtraInfo: For an NE client that requires high-precision time, you can run the command to enable the NTP high-precision client function and set the polling interval for sending packets.
